intro: Oldenlandia oxycoccoides, commonly known as the whiteleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
